video.title: Build a Social Media App with Django – Python Web Framework Tutorial
video.description:
Improve your Python Django skills by coding a social media app.

✏️ Course developed by CodeWithTomi. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/CodeWithTomi
🔗 Join CodeWithTomi's Discord Server: https://discord.gg/cjqNBHHhKV
🔗 Twitter: https://twitter.com/TomiTokko3

💻 Source code: https://github.com/tomitokko/django-social-media-website
💻 Template files: https://github.com/tomitokko/django-social-media-template

🔗 Download All Free Resources - https://codewithtomi.eo.page/mz396

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
(0:00:00) Intro    
(0:00:52) Project Demo    
(0:06:37) Project Setup
(0:14:20) URL Routing
(0:23:06) Template Setup
(0:27:52) Static Files
(0:36:47) Profile Model
(1:00:31) Signup
(1:33:11) Signin and Logout
(1:47:55) Account Settings
(2:17:00) Uploading Post
(2:49:55) Post Feed
(3:00:22) Like Post
(3:20:50) Profile Page
(3:37:20) Follow and Unfollow User
(4:10:23) Post Feed Updated
(4:18:35) Download Images
(4:21:03) Search User
(4:38:18) User Suggestions

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Raymond Odero
👾 Agustín Kussrow
👾 aldo ferretti
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

replies.author: Mickey
replies.text: create() is a bit different from create_user(). That tiny mistake can throw your entire project off. Happened with me, till I noticed.

replies.author: Mickey
replies.text:
Did you properly create the user instance in your sign-up view?

In the innermost else block, user = User.objecs.create_user(username=username, email=email, password=password)

topLevelComment.author: Mohammad Al-Shuwaiee
topLevelComment.text: Now I want to know something learning Django seperately is not enough right? I need to learn Javascript and react to be in good side????????

replies.author: Cliff Kimani
replies.text: yes. React is a great choice! Django is very great for backend programming and also creating APIs using django REST. The APIs can then be used as webhooks for Android aps, the web front end, iOS apps etc. The advantage with React is that you can make web, iOS & Android with the same code! So with django & React, you can be a fullstack web and cross-platform mobile dev.

replies.author: Aniket Yadav
replies.text: @Mohammad Al-Shuwaiee if you want only frontend job then javascript and react is enough. If you want to work as full stack then javascript with react for frontend and django(python)/nodejs(javascript)/ spring-boot(java) for backend will do.
